intro: Agrostemma dicline, commonly known as the bent-flower grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals that curve inward, giving it a distinctive appearance. Agrostemma dicline is an annual herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with well-drained soil.
